sentences.en: About 40 % of all made of ( native ) plants in california endemic.
sentences.cn: 大约所有加州本地植物的40%有风土病.

sentences.en: And religion are endemic producers of finite provinces of meaning.
sentences.cn: 因为艺术和宗教制造出特定的意义领域.

sentences.en: Distribution: Endemic to Hong Kong, only known from Tai Mo Shan.
sentences.cn: 地理分布: 香港特有种, 仅见于大帽山.

sentences.en: He said that racism is endemic in this country.
sentences.cn: 他说种族主义在该国很普遍.

sentences.en: He studied waters from five areas where mottling was endemic.
sentences.cn: 他研究有地方性牙病的五个地区的水.

sentences.en: Heptacodium miconioides Rehd ( Caprifoliaceae ), seven - son - flower, is an endemic to China.
sentences.cn: 七子花是我国特有的单种属植物, 也是受重点保护的濒危植物.

sentences.en: Penicillium marneffei infection is endemic in South China and Southeast Asia.
sentences.cn: 马尔尼菲青霉菌感染主要在中国的南方和东南亚地区呈地方性流行.

sentences.en: Polio was then endemic among children my age.
sentences.cn: 那时小儿麻痹症在我这个年纪的孩子中很常见。

sentences.en: Poverty is not endemic to cities although, perhaps because of the crowded conditions in certain areas.
sentences.cn: 虽然贫穷并非城市的特产, 但是可能由于某些地区的人口过多而使贫穷现象在该处较为明显.

sentences.en: Rabies is endemic in several wildlife populations throughout specific geographical areas.
sentences.cn: 狂犬病是地方病在几个野生动物遍及的特殊的地理区域.

sentences.en: Street crime is virtually endemic in large cities.
sentences.cn: 街头犯罪近乎是大城市的通病。

sentences.en: The chest disease is endemic among miners in this area.
sentences.cn: 这种胸部疾病是流行于本地区矿工中的地方病.

sentences.en: The is endemic to China and is thus of special botanical interests.
sentences.cn: 本种为中国特有,具有科学研究价值.

sentences.en: The islands have a number of interesting endemic species.
sentences.cn: 这些岛屿上有许多有趣的地方性物种.

sentences.en: Violent crime is now endemic in parts of Chicago.
sentences.cn: 芝加哥一些地区暴力犯罪成患。

sentences.en: Yellow fever is endemic to parts of central Africa.
sentences.cn: 黄热病是中非一些地区的地方流行病.

words.tran_cn: 特有现象；地方特殊性；地方性生长；特有分布
[医][内科]地方性的；[生物]风土的

trans.tran_cn: 某地特有的，（尤指疾病）地方性的，风土的，（动，植物）某些特产的
trans.tran_en: an endemic disease or problem is always present in a particular place, or among a particular group of people
